filteredArticles.headline: Angelina Eimannsberger | Let’s validate each other during isolation
filteredArticles.subhead: The Feminist Minute | ‘I see you and I love you’ instead of ‘Oh, I didn’t think about that’
filteredArticles.abstract: It’s key to keep an open mind and listen carefully, even if it's virtually, to what everyone around you is experiencing.

filteredArticles.subhead: In Colombia, people are more terrified to die from hunger than the virus

filteredArticles.headline: Senior Column by Michel Liu | “Play hard” along the way
filteredArticles.abstract: I, too, was anticipating Senior Week, Commencement, and all the last goodbyes we never got to say. But after everything that has happened, my doubts about taking a “scenic route” instead of the expressway to my goals have vanished.

filteredArticles.headline: Guest Column by Borna Saeednia | From a TA to Penn Class of 2020: Congratulations!
filteredArticles.abstract: To the Class of 2020, I want to express my deepest gratitude for the contributions you have made, and for giving me an opportunity to learn with you and from you.

filteredArticles.headline: Urooba Abid | Ramadan holds new meaning in quarantine
filteredArticles.subhead: Urooba Unplugged | Now more than ever, Ramadan is a valued spiritual journey
filteredArticles.abstract: Quarantine has left time for many of us to do what our overstimulated society so rarely leaves time for — reflection. Coincidentally, this is the main goal of Ramadan.

filteredArticles.headline: Editorial | Penn should introduce a preventative mental health care model
filteredArticles.abstract: In light of the COVID-19 global pandemic and the immense stressors it produces, Penn should adopt a proactive rather than reactive stance towards mental health.

filteredArticles.headline: Guest Column by Louis Lin | What graduation means for FGLI students during the pandemic
filteredArticles.abstract: Ever since Penn first announced there would be no in-person ceremonies this year, I have been thinking about what graduation means as a first-generation, low-income student, and what it means for my family.

filteredArticles.headline: Senior Column by Sarah Fortinsky | To Eric Jacobs, the one who made the DP home
filteredArticles.abstract: My graduation from Penn coincides with Eric Jacobs’ retirement from the DP after four decades as general manager. From the start of my time at Penn, I’ve known Eric to be the DP’s guiding light.

filteredArticles.headline: Guest Column by Penn Leads the Vote Leadership | You deserve to be heard. Vote on June 2nd
filteredArticles.abstract: By voting in the upcoming primary election, students at Penn will be able to make a difference in who represents our communities in Congress and the state legislature. One person, one vote is perpetually under threat and this year is no different, if not more than ever before.

filteredArticles.subhead: Views with Varun | COVID-19 exposes the flaws in our insurance system
filteredArticles.abstract: Every human life has equal value, and it’s time for our healthcare system to recognize that.
